word: The followers of Jesus need not be amazed if they are made partakers of His sufferings. Their motives will be questioned, and they will meet with disappointments on every hand; but Christ endured all this. How can He look upon those for whom He has paid so infinite a price and "be satisfied," when they have never appreciated His great gift to them? "Consider Him that endured such contradiction of sinners against Himself, lest ye be wearied, and faint in your minds."
